entries.meaning: (mathematics) Related by an isomorphism; having a structure-preserving one-to-one correspondence.
examples: Let A, B be the ordered sets in Figure 10.3. Let C be the direct product of infinitely many copies of the two element chain 2. Then AC is isomorphic to BC, but A is not isomorphic to B.

entries.meaning: (biology) Having a similar structure or function to something that is not related genetically or through evolution.
Having identical relevant structure; being structure-preserving while undergoing certain invertible transformations.
